block.p: Vanessa Lynn Bottjer, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred K. Bottjer of Westbury, N.Y., was married yesterday to Henry Shields Day Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Day of Hingham, Mass. The Very Rev. James J. Cardone, dean of the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City, N.Y., performed the ceremony there, with the Rev. Kevin McBrien, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Day, 26, is a marketing manager in asset management at Citigroup in New York, promoting Smith Barney mutual funds. She graduated from Bucknell University. Her father is an associate vice president in the private client group at the First Albany Corporation, a financial services business in New York. Her mother, Lorraine A. Bottjer, is the practice manager in the urology department at Winthrop-University Hospital in Mineola, N.Y.

Vanessa Lynn Bottjer, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred K. Bottjer of Westbury, N.Y., was married yesterday to Henry Shields Day Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. Day of Hingham, Mass. The Very Rev. James J. Cardone, dean of the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City, N.Y., performed the ceremony there, with the Rev. Kevin McBrien, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Day, 26, is a marketing manager in asset management at Citigroup in New York, promoting Smith Barney mutual funds. She graduated from Bucknell University. Her father is an associate vice president in the private client group at the First Albany Corporation, a financial services business in New York. Her mother, Lorraine A. Bottjer, is the practice manager in the urology department at Winthrop-University Hospital in Mineola, N.Y.

Mr. Day, 29, is known as Shields. He is a chartered financial analyst and an investment research associate for the health-care services industry at Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. He graduated from Union College and received an M.B.A. from New York University. His mother, Lucinda P. Day, is a director of the Hingham Cemetery, where she is a volunteer. His father retired as a portfolio manager at the Keystone Investment Management Corporation in Boston.
